H0.text: who made the first spanish landing on the mainland of north america. Hernando de Soto

H1.text: who made the first spanish landing on the mainland of north america. Juan Ponce de León

H2.text: who made the first spanish landing on the mainland of north america. Álvar Núñez Cabeza de Vaca

H3.text: who made the first spanish landing on the mainland of north america. 1535

A4.text: In March 1521, Ponce de León finally returned to Southwest Florida with the first large-scale attempt to establish a Spanish colony in what is now the continental United States.

A5.text: Spanish slave expeditions had been regularly raiding the Bahamas since 1494, and there is some evidence that one or more of these slavers made it as far as the shores of Florida.

A6.text: In May 1539, de Soto landed nine ships with over 620 men and 220 horses in an area of La Florida generally identified as the current location of south Tampa Bay.

A7.text: He is the first European documented as having crossed the Mississippi River.
